description: AlienVault unifies all of your essential security tools in one location and combines them with real-time threat intelligence.
steps: After registering, you will see apiKey in console https://otx.alienvault.com/api/

blocks.name: getAllIndicators
blocks.description: Export indicators for pulses in your pulse subscriptions.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to include per page.

args.name: page
args.info: Which page of results is desired.

args.name: types
args.info: Comma seperated list of indicator types to limit results to.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Iso format datetime (UTC) string) Only include pulses modified more recently than a specific time.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForIPv4
blocks.description: Indicator page api for IPv4 Addresses.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name (one of general, reputation, geo, malware, url_list, passive_dns,http_scans).See more in readme.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForIPv6
blocks.description: Indicator page api for IPv6 Addresses.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name (one of general, reputation, geo, malware, url_list, passive_dns).See more in readme.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForDomain
blocks.description: Indicator page api for domain names.Example domains: 'rghost.net', 'spywaresite.info'.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name (one of general, reputation, geo, malware, url_list, passive_dns).See more in readme.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForHostname
blocks.description: Indicator page api for hostname names.Example hostnames: 'otx.alienvault.com', 'bad-guys.no-ip.org', 'alpha.beta.google.co.uk'.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name (one of general, reputation, geo, malware, url_list, passive_dns).See more in readme.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForFileHashes
blocks.description: Indicator page api for files (file hashes).

blocks.name: getIndicatorForUrl
blocks.description: Indicator page api for URL.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForCVE
blocks.description: Indicator page api for CVEs (MITRE's Common Vulnerability Enumeration).

args.name: section
args.info: Section name.General: MITRE CVE data (CPEs, CWEs, etc.), any pulses this indicator is on, list of the other sections currently available for this URL.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForNIDS
blocks.description: Indicator page api for NIDSs.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name.General: General metadata about NIDS.

blocks.name: getIndicatorForCorrelationRules
blocks.description: Indicator page api for Correlation Rules.

args.name: section
args.info: Section name.General: General metadata about the Correlation Rule.

blocks.name: getPulse
blocks.description: Indicator page api for Correlation Rules.

blocks.name: getIndicatorsForPulse
blocks.description: Returns paginated list view of the indicators inside the pulse pulseId.

blocks.name: getSharePulsesAnIndicator
blocks.description: Return all pulses that share an indicator with this pulse.

blocks.name: getSubscriptions
blocks.description: Threat intelligence subscriptions.All pulses by users you are subscribed to;All pulses you are directly subscribed to;All pulses you have created yourself;All pulses from groups you are a member of;

blocks.name: getActivity
blocks.description: Activity feed consists of pulses:All pulse subscriptions (directly subscribed to pulse, and all pulses by subscribed to users);All pulses created by myself;All pulses by users I am following;

blocks.name: createPulse
blocks.description: Allow users to submit pulses via the API.

args.name: description
args.info: A brief description of the pulse, the threat it addresses.

args.name: public
args.info: Public implies other users can see / subscribe to your pulse.

args.name: TLP
args.info: Amber and red pulses MUST be private.Default is green.

args.name: indicators
args.info: indicators (list of objects) List of objects (dicts): {type: 'email', indicator: 'badguy@malware.com', description: ''}. Every object in the list must contain these three fields.

args.name: tags
args.info: (list of strings) Tags to describe your pulse. i.e. malware, phishing, hacking.team;

args.name: references
args.info: references (list of strings) External references to associate with this pulse.

blocks.name: getIndicatorType
blocks.description: Returns string representations of each indicator type (i.e. `domain`), as recognized by OTX.For use in indicator validation and create pulse.

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: List events, such as subscribe/unsubscribe to user/pulse.See more in readme.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to include per page.

args.name: page
args.info: Which page of results is desired.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Iso format datetime (UTC) string) Only include pulses modified more recently than a specific time.

blocks.name: getUserInfo
blocks.description: Returns authenticated users or passed in user created pulse feed, default sorted by latest modified.

blocks.name: getUsersBySearch
blocks.description: Search for users matcing query.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to include per page.

args.name: page
args.info: Which page of results is desired.

args.name: sort
args.info: Order by one of these fields: username, pulse_count.

args.name: searchQuery
args.info: Query string to search results with

blocks.name: getPulsesBySearch
blocks.description: Search for pulses matcing query.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to include per page.

args.name: page
args.info: Which page of results is desired.

args.name: sort
args.info: Order by one of these fields: username, pulse_count.

args.name: searchQuery
args.info: Query string to search results with.

blocks.name: getMe
blocks.description: Validate your API Key configuration. If valid, some basic information about the user account corresponding to the API Key supplied will be returned.

blocks.name: createActionForUsers
blocks.description: Perform actions like follow/subscribe to other users by username.

args.name: username
args.info: The name to which will be perform actions.

blocks.name: addTagsForPulse
blocks.description: Add tags for pulse.

blocks.name: removeTagsFromPulse
blocks.description: Add tags for pulse.

blocks.name: removeIndicatorsFromPulse
blocks.description: Remove indicators from pulse.

blocks.name: updateIndicatorsForPulse
blocks.description: Edit indicators from pulse.

blocks.name: addIndicatorsForPulse
blocks.description: Add indicators from pulse.

blocks.name: updatePulse
blocks.description: In an edit you can pass any pulse field(s) you wish to change. For string or numeric fields, pass the new value you wish to have. For `list` fields, pass a dictionary that can contain a `add` or `remove` field. For `add`, pass a list of new values.See more in readme.

args.name: body
args.info: Post body should be json format, containing fields you wish to edit.See more in readme.
